result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance M Mcbride

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrance M Mcbride in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Terrance M Mcbride.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

As to Counts 1, 2:  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Plea Addendum

Jury Instruction 1321

Jury Instruction 1335

Defendant Terrance M Mcbride in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended criminal complaint, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.

Court ordered charge amended to 

AS TO COUNT 1:  CARRYING A CONCEALED WEAPON contrary to sec 941.23(2), 939.51(3)(a) Wisconsin Statutes section(s).
AS TO COUNT 2:  ENDANGERING SAFETY BY USE OF DANGEROUS WEAPON (DETECTABLE AMOUNT OF CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE) contrary to sec 941.20(1)(bm), 939.51(3)(a) Wisconsin Statutes section(s).

Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Terrance M Mcbride in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for Scheduling 
Discussion held off th erecord. .  Defense in receipt of a tentative dpa offer. Defendant has tad evaluation scheduled 7/14/2022.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Terrance M Mcbride in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.This hearing will held Remotely streamed Live through dacast - Via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Terrance M Mcbride in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
